title: 5 Egg Recipes for a Healthy 2020
author: Chino Valley Ranchers
content:
It’s a New Year and if you’ve made a resolution to eat healthier this year, we’re happy to help you out by sharing a few healthy egg recipes. These five egg recipes are easy to make, delicious and nutritious. Enjoy these dishes with Chino Valley Ranchers eggs and you can consider your New Year’s resolution met. 

Omelette Stuffed Peppers

Choose any color bell peppers and stuff them with bacon, cheddar cheese and pasture-raised eggs for a bright orange pop of color. Sprinkle in a few spices and you’ve got a dish ready for baking. These are perfect for dinner parties or for a quick lunch at work.

View the full recipe here.

Ham & Cheese Egg Cups

This breakfast dish packs quite a bit of protein and is just what you need to fuel your workouts. Simply line each cup with ham, sprinkle with cheddar and crack an egg. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes and enjoy a delicious reward for your hard work at the gym!

View the full recipe here.

Breakfast Tomatoes

Sure, you’ve heard of stuffed peppers, but have you ever ventured to stuffed-tomato land? Simply hollow out a tomato with a metal spoon, drizzle with olive oil, and crack a Chino Valley Ranchers cage-free egg into the center. Sprinkle salt, pepper, chives and parmesan and you’ve got a unique, visually-appealing egg dish.

View the full recipe here.

Cauliflower Benedict

Imagine hash browns made with cauliflower instead of potatoes. Mind-blowing, yes. For this dish, all you need is ½ a head of cauliflower, one large egg, one cup shredded cheddar, salt, two large eggs, four egg yolks, Canadian bacon, butter, cornstarch and some spices. With a total cooking time of 30 minutes, your taste buds will thank you all day.

View the full recipe here.

Jalapeño Popper Egg Cups

This recipe can be made for breakfast or as an appetizer for dinner. This recipe calls for bacon, 10 large pasture-raised eggs, shredded cheddar, sour cream, two jalapeños and some spices. Delicious, healthy and a sure crowd-pleaser.  

View the full recipe here.
